class_notes: Course Title "Crossroads: Learning Italian through Gamification"In 2002 the computer programmer Nick Pelling invented the term 'gamification' to suggest that the elements and the positive characteristics of a game could be transferred to other areas and engage the participants in their trades more actively. In the course 'Learning Italian through Gamification,' students will apply the building blocks of games (such as goals, rules, and point systems) to the process of teaching and learning a foreign language. In this project-based course, Computer Science students and Italian as a Second Language students will team up, design, and develop educational games to support teaching and learning of Italian Arts and Literature topics.
course_description: A side-car course brings together a subset of students from two courses that overlap in methodologies, topics, etc., to create a short interdisciplinary course that runs simultaneously with its two sponsoring courses. One credit, S/U only. Schedule and format arranged by sponsoring professors.
